info.title: GetAccess API
info.description:
GetAccess is a provider of a universal API for small business financial software, used by service providers to build integrations with the software packages their small business customers use. This documentation should serve as a guide to help you through the process of building those integrations. If you have any questions at any time, please get in touch with us atÂ contact@getaccess.ai. # Introduction The getAccess API is built on RESTful principles. All request and response payloads are encoded in JSON. For security purposes, all requests must be sent through HTTPS. To get access to the Developer keys and interface with the API, please contact contact@getaccess.ai. # Modes The API is available in two modes that can be accessed using different endpoints. Below are the descriptions for the same on
Modes Host Description
Sandox https://sandbox-api.getaccess.ai Use Sandbox mode to build and test your integration. In this mode, you must use test credentials to authenticate with api platforms. All API endpoints will return mock data and no actual updates are made to any account.
Production https://api.getaccess.ai Use Production mode to go live with your integration. Your end-users will use their login credentials to authenticate with their customer accounts. API endpoints return real data and updates are made to customer accounts. Note that in this mode, all API calls are billable.
# Connection The connection workflow consists of 2 steps:

Initiation

This step consists of requesting our servers for the rediruct url for the respective ERP system that the customer has chosen, these routes have been documented in the Company-Connection section. Once you get the redirect URL, it is the implementors job to redirect the customer to this url for authentication. Once the authentication is completed the status of the company changes from registered(which is assigned when the company is created) to linked.
For khatabook, the procedure is different. The implementor should ask the customer's phone number and send that as a query parameter phone as a GET to /company/connection/khata. In the next step the customer should be asked about the otp(which will be sent to their mobile after the GET request) and POST the phone number as phone and otp as otp. Only after this the linking of a khatabook customer would be complete.
Linked status means that the company has linked the ERP but is yet to connect to an organisation within the ERP. Since an ERP software might contain many companies, of which we are interested in only one, the next step asks the customer for exactly this information.

Connection

In this step the customer is asked to chose one company from the ERP system, he/she has linked their account to. After performing this step, the status of all the customers becomes connected and they can start fetching and pushing reports.

QuickBooks

This step is omitted for quickbooks which gets the status of connected on the initiation step itself, since the authentication mechanism in quickbooks authenticates the app for only one company, so no need for this step.

Zoho

Get the report with the report name 'GA.Reports.Zoho.OrganizationsData', which returns the data about the organizations a customer has, then you ask the cutomer to select and org and using the Company-Connection PUT route, send the organisationId of the org selected as companyReference.

Xero

Procedure is similar to Zoho. GET report 'GA.Reports.Xero.OrganizationsData', make the customer select one of the companies and then PUT the tenantId as the companyReference to company/connection

Khata

For khatabook no extra request needs to be made, once the customer is linked, you need to fetch the company object using GET bank/companises/{companyId} and then the list of books available in the customer's account is in the field company.dataConnection.other.books. Make the customer select the book the customer wants to use and PUT the book_id as companyReference to company/connection.
